content.raw:
Backward compatibility is part of `deprecation`, but we cannot always guarantee that every function can be made backward compatible. Semantic versioning indicates to users that major version may/will break downstream code. The changelog and migration guide also help to fill in the gaps.

Think of `deprecation` as a guide, where as not breaking ABI/API withing minor and patch version is a hard and fast rule.
